name: Cold Spider(Reality)
appearance: A pale, chitinous spider with an unnaturally cold, lifeless body. In the real world it is roughly dog-sized, with black, glossy eyes and barbed legs capable of clinging to walls and ceilings.
personality: Alien and predatory. Cold spiders act on instinct and the will of the Spider God, showing no empathy and little self-preservation beyond ensuring successful reproduction.
background: Cold spiders originate from the Dreamlands and have crossed into the real world through vast webs woven by Atlach-Nacha. Their forms are weakened in reality, but they retain their most horrifying trait: infecting humans by implanting spider eggs, which may kill the host or transform them into spider-humans.
secrets: Some infected hosts may survive and transform into spider-humans
Cold spiders are less powerful in the real world than in the Dreamlands

clues.clueText: Cold spiders enter the real world through giant webs hidden in the church and nearby areas.
Their bite can infect humans with spider eggs, leading to death or transformation.

relationships.description: Cold spiders are servants and offspring of the Spider God.
relationships.history: They act as extensions of Atlach-Nacha's will, spreading its influence between worlds.

notes:
Cold Spider Overview, Infection & Treatment (applicable to Nancy’s bite):

General Traits & Behavior:
Cold spiders infect humans through biting, implanting spider eggs directly into the host’s body. Each cold spider can attack once per combat round. A successful bite deals 1D3 damage and carries a risk of infection; if the victim fails a Luck check, they immediately enter Infection Stage 0. Cold spiders possess minimal natural armor (1 point, chitinous shell). There is a 10% chance that an individual cold spider knows the spell “Call Atlach-Nacha.”

Infection Consequences:
Most infected victims die during the infection process. Those who survive may be ‘assimilated’ into half-human, half-spider creatures known as Spider-Humans (蛛人).

Sanity Effects:
Seeing a cold spider alone does not cause SAN loss. However, witnessing a cold spider tear through an infected host’s flesh and escape—spraying blood and black pus—causes a SAN loss of 1d3 / 1d6.

Infection Progression (roll succeeds = no progression):
Stage 0 – Regular Luck: Mild prickling sensation, as if something crawled over exposed skin; small pink bruises appear.
Stage 1 – Regular CON: Pain; bitten area feels warm, wound turns bright red.
Stage 2 – Hard CON: Bite area swells slightly (about half an inch), bright red lump forms.
Stage 3 – Hard CON: Swelling grows to 2 inches; redness spreads, center darkens; extreme pain on contact. Victim loses 1 HP.
Stage 4 – Extreme CON: Swelling grows to 4 inches and hardens; black core expands to 1 inch; victim feels movement under the skin. Victim loses 1 HP and must make a SAN check (1 / 1d3).
Stage 5 – Extreme CON: A developing cold spider may burst from the hardened abscess, tearing flesh and spraying blood and black pus before escaping. Victim loses 1d3+1 HP and must make a SAN check (1d3 / 1d6). Victim may die or transform.

Treatment:
The only treatment is to surgically cut open the cyst and remove the young spider. This can only be attempted when the infection is at stages 2–4 and requires a Medicine check with sharp tools.

The procedure is extremely painful. To succeed, one of the following methods must be used:
1) Willpower Method: Patient makes a POW check while enduring pain, and the operator makes a Medicine check. Both must succeed.
2) Restraint Method: Operator makes a combined Medicine + DEX check (both must succeed) to restrain the patient and perform the operation safely.
3) Anesthesia Method: If anesthetics are available, the operator makes two Medicine checks (one for anesthesia, one for surgery). Both must succeed.

Outcome:
• Success: Infection stage resets to 0; patient suffers 1 HP damage.
• Failure: The spider burrows deeper; the patient loses 1d3 HP.

Limits & Keeper Guidance:
• Each person may undergo this type of field surgery only once.
• If the spider burrows deeper after a failed attempt, only major hospital surgery can remove it.
• If not treated in time and the infection reaches Stage 5, the spider bursting out may cause even greater bodily harm at the Keeper’s discretion.
• The Keeper may adjust damage at Stage 5 or show leniency if circumstances or narrative pacing require it.
